text: Michael Chertoff (born November 28, 1953) is an American attorney. He was the second United States Secretary of Homeland Security under President George W. Bush. He was the co-author of the USA PATRIOT Act. He served as a judge on the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit, as a federal prosecutor, and as Assistant U.S. Attorney General. He succeeded Tom Ridge as U.S. Secretary of Homeland Security on February 15, 2005. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1953 births Category:Living people Category:American judges Category:Lawyers from New Jersey Category:Harvard University alumni Category:Politicians from New Jersey Category:United States Secretaries of Homeland Security Category:People from Elizabeth, New Jersey Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
